Retrieved February 29, 2016 ==Biography== Johannes von Helmont was ordained a priest in the Order of Saint Benedict. On 7 Feb 1508, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Julius II as Auxiliary Bishop of Trier. On 7 Jul 1508, he was consecrated bishop. He served as Auxiliary Bishop of Trier until his resignation in Jul 1517. He died on 9 Nov 1519. == References == Category:16th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Julius II Category:1519 deaths Category:Benedictine bishops
